definitions.definition: To enter a program or other instructions into (a computer or other electronic device) to instruct it to do a particular task.
definitions.example: He programmed the DVR to record his favorite show.

definitions.definition: To develop (software) by writing program code.
definitions.example: I programmed a small game as a demonstration.

definitions.definition: To put together the schedule of an event.
To cause to automatically behave in a particular way.
definitions.example: The lab rat was programmed to press the lever when the bell rang.

definitions.definition: The designing, scheduling or planning of a radio or television program/programme.
definitions.example: The network changed its programming to mess with DVRs again.

definitions.definition: The act of writing a computer program.
definitions.example: Management wanted to know how much programming the project would need.

definitions.definition: The software that controls a machine, or the logic expressed in such software; operating instructions.
definitions.example: A robot's programming doesn't allow for love.
